intro: Triumfetta kenneallyi, commonly known as the Kenneally's triumfetta, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. It thrives in sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
